description.content: Signup with a provided email and password. The endpoint will also automatically create a new user object in Users table. If you have email verification enabled in authentication settings, the system will first create the user in disabled state and send a verification email to the user with a link to verify the email. Once the email is verified the user will be transformed to enabled state. In order to verify the email, use Verify Email endpoint.
Sign in with a provided email and password.

item.name: Create URL for OAUTH sign in

description.content: Generate a sign-in link with a selected OAUTH provider. `providerId` - google.com, facebook.com, or github.com. `callBackUri` - url where you want to redirect users after OAUTH sign in.

item.name: Sign in with a selected OAUTH provider

description.content: Sign in with a selected OAUTH provider. `sessionId` - ID of OAUTH session returned from POST /accounts/sign-in/auth-url request. `providerId` - google.com, facebook.com, or github.com. `callBackUri` - url where you want to redirect users after OAUTH sign in. `token` - idToken or accessToken returned from POST /accounts/sign-in/auth-url request. Used for Google and Facebook sign in. If token is provided, `code` parameter is being ignored. `code` - value that will be exchanged for access token.
Send an invite to a user via email. The system will first create a user in a disabled state until the invite is accepted via link to sent to the provided email

Endpoint to reset a password of selected user. The user will receive an email prompting him to change the existing password by following a url. Note that you need to have a reset password url specified in authentication settings in order for this endpoint to work.

Endpoint to verify the email based on `oobCode` and `uid` provided in the email sent to the user. The `oobCode` and `uid` are found in the email verification url. Email verification url has the following structure: {email_conf_url}?oobCode={oobCode}&uid={uid}.

Endpoint to verify password reset request based on `oobCode` provided in the email sent to the user. The `oobCode` can be found in the password reset url. Password reset url has the following structure: {email_conf_url}?oobCode={oobCode}

Endpoint to verify invitation based on `oobCode` and `uid` provided in the email sent to the user. The `oobCode` and `uid` are found in the password reset url. Password reset url has the following structure: {email_conf_url}?oobCode={oobCode}&uid={uid}.
Get a list of authentication providers for the given email.
Delete account based on the Bearer token. The system will also delete the corresponding user object inside the Users table.

A collection of endpoints to manage accounts data. Including registration, login, user creation, deletion and more. Please note that the selected authentication method must be activated in your dashboard before you will be able to make requests to the endpoints described in this collection.
